design_work.title: Keurig Website Re-creation
design_work.desc: A re-creation of the Keurig e-commerce site that sells coffee makers and allows users to sign up with their first name, last name, email, and password. They can also login and logout easily based on user feedback. Once a user is logged in, they are able to add multiple items to their cart, remove items from their cart, and checkout. This application is fully responsive and uses various tools such as Firebase.

design_work.title: Professor's Wheel
design_work.desc: A full web application created using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. For high school and college students who have lower test scores and graduation rates, Professor's Wheel is a trivia app and learning activity that will make learning more interactive and fun. It features a spinning category wheel, in-app audio and buzzers, a timer, and a counter point system.

design_work.title: Global Jams
design_work.desc: A full database-driven Web Application developed with PHP and MySQL. Global Jams is a website that provides users with a taste of the top 2019 albums from countries around the world. The site features an inventory database, a login page, a search bar, and a working shopping cart. There are also admin features such as adding, deleting, and editing albums in the inventory.

design_work.title: Tic Tac Toe
design_work.desc: A full web application created using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. In this game, players alternate placing Xs and Os on the game board until either oppent has three in a row or all nine squares are filled. It features greensock animations, SVG's, several classes, and a counter-point system.

design_work.title: AraBee Language Program
design_work.desc: This application is built as a program to help students learn the language of Arabic. Anyone can create an account to this page using thier first and last name, email, and a password. A user is able to browse the culture, tutorials, and view their own flashcards. Once signed in, a user is able to create, read, update, and delete their flashcards freely. In general, this is a user friendly and bright website to encourage students while learning. It was designed in Adobe XD and built using Firebase.

design_work.title: Bayside Beat
design_work.desc: A full website created using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Bayside Beat is a blog website about the local food and recreational places to visit in the Bay area. It features images, reviews, and a column section.

design_work.title: Julie's Skincare Store
design_work.desc: A single-page application created in Codesandbox using primarily Vue.js and Vuex programming. This site showcases several different types of skincare products and their details in an aesthetic display. It features images, json data files, and greensock animations.

design_work.title: Red Line App
design_work.desc: A wireframe of an application using Mockflow.com. The Red Line is a new bus system that runs from downtown Indy to the University of Indianapolis. This fictional app was designed to enhance the user experience, allow them to search points of interests, and buy tickets. It features a map, search bar, info cards with star reviews, and multiple payment methods.

design_work.title: Plan of Study
design_work.desc: A web application created using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The Personalized Plan of Study is a website that allows Informatics students to pick and choose between courses and visually plan out their fours years of college. It features course boxes, color-coded categories, text input boxes, and HTML5 Drag-and-Drop. It also has 'Save', 'Reset', and 'Print' buttons at the bottom of the page.

design_work.title: Breakout Game
design_work.desc: A full web game created using p5 and JavaScript. In this game, players use the left and right keyboard keys to move a paddle in the right place for a moving ball to bounce off of and hit a colored block. Each colored block hit earns them a point. It features various variables, functions, and if/else statements.

art_work.title: Chair Sculpture
art_work.desc: An old, thrifted chair reinvented into a cozy, lounge chair for any home. This Chair Sculpture stands to express the emotion of bright, child-like happiness. It was created by fully disassembling the parts of an old chair, cutting and fastening them together in a shape similar to a rocking chair, and painting the wood a neutral white to let the teal upholstery pop. Broken CDs serve as the detailing on the arm rests to add some shine.

art_work.title: Everlasting Emblems
art_work.desc: A fictional company logo and full stationary set with a teal accent color to match. Everlasting Emblems symbolizes any sort of Logo-Maker or Graphic Design company. The full stationary set was all created using Adobe Illustrator, and includes an envelope, business card, and letterhead.

art_work.title: Drawings + Paintings
art_work.desc: A series of artwork created during the Beginning Drawing I, Beginning Drawing II, and Beginning Painting I courses offered at the Herron School of Art. Most paintings were created using oil-based paints and fine brushes. Most drawings were created using charcoal sticks and graphite pencils.

art_work.title: Mafiacent Movie Poster
art_work.desc: A creative take on the Disney movie known as Maleficent. For this project, we were tasked with researching two different movie genres. We had to chose a movie from one of the genres and design a movie poster that would fit the second genre. Here I took the fantasy movie Maleficent and transformed it into the gangster genre. This was all designed in Adobe Photoshop.

art_work.title: Investigation Exploration
art_work.desc: A series of four different movie posters, made using Adobe Illustrator, depicting the same fictional movie, Investigation Exploration. Investigation Exploration is supposed to be an action movie of three sisters moving to the streets of Egypt for the summer to find happiness and passion. Each movie poster was made with a different aspect of the movie in mind and each has its own voice.

art_work.title: Bubble Bobble
art_work.desc: A stop motion animation of the iconic Bubble Bobble game. All of the graphics were printed out and placed on a board. The video features 362 different images, which were edited and sequenced in Adobe After Effects.

art_work.title: Maralumi Chocolate
art_work.desc: A unique logotype of a chosen word crafted using typography principles. Through research, semiotic nuances of the word were identified and given a visual voice. Topics considered during the logotype development include type characters, letterform, style, texture, weight, emotional tone, etc.

art_work.title: Fictional Company Logos
art_work.desc: A collection of four different company logos. North Beacon, Forward Thinking, and Side Slice are all fictitious companies created for the purpose of portraying a company persona through a logo. Each of these logos were made with Adobe Illustrator using various negative space and coloring techniques.

art_work.title: Digital Media Projects
art_work.desc: A series of projects created in Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator for the Digital Media Imagery course offered at SoIC. The clever product image for a fictional wine company depicting flowers growing from a wine bottle was created for the advertisement project. The digital eye painting was created using various painting tools within Photoshop.

art_work.title: Blender Renders
art_work.desc: A group of 3D models including a mug, donut, plate, pool balls, and a teddy bear. All the models were designed and rendered using the Blender program and toolset. These designs feature various 3D shapes, colors, and functions.

art_work.title: Percy Jackson
art_work.desc: Three different cover designs of 'Percy Jackson and the Last Olympian', a novel by Rick Riordan. Each design was created in Illustrator using various tools such as gradient, curvature, and shape builder tool.

art_work.title: E.L.F. Rebranding
art_work.desc: A full redesign of the E.L.F. cosmetics brand, including a website mockup, promotional video, and poster. The website mockup was designed in Adobe XD. The promotional video was edited in Adobe Premiere using various templates and transitions. Lastly, the poster was created in Adobe Illustrator. The typography, color scheme, and brand identity were considered in the redesign process.
